Html:
Hello,
When I run Get-WindowInventoryToClixml.ps1, I get the output that no machines found! I'm running this on my own pc on our company network. Here is the command:

.\Get-WindowsInventoryToClixml.ps1 -Computername $env:COMPUTERNAME -LoggingPreference Verbose

And here is the logging info:
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9093 ? Starting Script: \WindowsPowerShell\Get-WindowsInventoryToClixml.ps1
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9363 ? Beginning network scan
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9393 ? -ComputerName: MyMachine
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9413 ? -PrivateOnly: False
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9433 ? -MaxConcurrencyThrottle: 8
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9453 ? -ResolveAliases: False
2014-01-29 15:22:25.9483 ? Resolving IP address for MyMachine
2014-01-29 15:22:26.0253 ? Testing PING connectivity to 1 addresses
2014-01-29 15:22:26.0393 $ Testing PING connectivity to MyMachine (##.##.##.##) [1 of 1]
2014-01-29 15:22:28.1133 $ PING response from MyMachine (##.##.#.##): True
2014-01-29 15:22:28.3683 $ PING connectivity test complete
2014-01-29 15:22:28.3713 ? Testing WMI connectivity to 1 addresses
2014-01-29 15:22:28.3813 $ Testing WMI connectivity to MyMachine (##.##.#.##) [1 of 1]
2014-01-29 15:22:28.6343 $ WMI response from MyMachine (##.##.#.##): True
2014-01-29 15:22:28.8943 $ WMI connectivity test complete
2014-01-29 15:22:28.9153 ? Network scan complete
2014-01-29 15:22:28.9183 ? -IP Addresses Scanned: 1
2014-01-29 15:22:28.9203 ? -PING Replies: 1
2014-01-29 15:22:28.9233 ? -WMI Replies: 1
2014-01-29 15:22:28.9293 ? Beginning machine scan
2014-01-29 15:22:29.0253 ? Scanning MyMachine on IP address ##.##.#.## [Machine 1 of 1]
2014-01-29 15:22:36.5693 ? Machine scan complete (Success: 0; Failure: 0)
2014-01-29 15:22:36.5763 + No machines found!
2014-01-29 15:22:36.5813 ? End Script: \WindowsPowerShell\Get-WindowsInventoryToClixml.ps1

Any help would be greatly appreciated. If I need to provide more information, please let me know.
Thanks,
Joey

Hi Joey,
What version of SQL Power Doc are you running? (Noted: I really should include that in the log file!)

At first glance I'm not sure what's going on here, but let's start with the version so I can look at the code and see if there's something I didn't account for somewhere...

--Kendal
